title: How to Keep Walnuts

steps.headline: Leave the walnuts intended for keeping in their shells.
Place the walnuts into an earthen ware pot.
Fill the pot almost to the top with the walnuts.
steps.description: Leave the last 5 centimeter (2.0 in) free.

steps.headline: Fill the rest of the pot with sawdust.
Store the earthenware pot in a cool, dry place.
Use as needed.
steps.description: Each time you'll need to remove the sawdust layer, so have a container handy to put it in while gathering walnuts. Return the sawdust after you've removed walnuts.

text: Leave the walnuts intended for keeping in their shells.  Place the walnuts into an earthen ware pot. Layering them is fine. Fill the pot almost to the top with the walnuts. Leave the last 5 centimeter (2.0 in) free. Fill the rest of the pot with sawdust. Pat down firmly. Store the earthenware pot in a cool, dry place.  Use as needed. Each time you'll need to remove the sawdust layer, so have a container handy to put it in while gathering walnuts. Return the sawdust after you've removed walnuts.
